page.title: 02STRENSHAM LOCK, RIVER AVON
page.content: Strensham Lock on the River Avon is maintained by the Lower Avon Navigational Trust{(LANT).} They appoint a lock-keeper, the present one is a woman. She manages alone as her husband is in hospital. They have a tied house. Extensive work was carried out on the lock in 1975 when the gates became electrically operated. The lock is busy in Summer with privately owned and hired holiday boats. During a week in July 1985, 306 passed through and 94 on a Sunday. The number increases during the School holidays. The lock can be manually operated if necessary. The river is prone to flooding when the lock-keeper is completely cut off and has to keep good food supplies.
